triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Core machine learning paradigm that the paper builds upon for agent learning in multiagent environments.

triples.name: Multi-agent reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Primary research domain that addresses learning behavior of multiple agents in shared environments.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Framework of interacting intelligent agents fundamental to the cooperative multiagent problem setting.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: Core entity in the system that perceives environment and takes actions to achieve goals.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: Knowledge reuse technique related to teaching and knowledge transfer between agents.

triples.name: Distributed artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: Framework for solving complex problems through distributed learning and decision-making by multiple agents.

triples.name: Coordination game
triples.relevance: Game-theoretic concept addressing how agents can coordinate to achieve mutual benefit.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning algorithm
triples.relevance: Novel teaching algorithm (LeCTR) proposed by the paper for peer-to-peer knowledge sharing in multiagent reinforcement learning systems.
